item.title: Replicating Flowingdata Population Charts in R
item.description: Nathan Yau recently produced a number of really nice looking visualisations of population data as part of an article entitled “Ask the Question, Visualize the Answer”…

item.title: MakeoverMonday 22-10-2018
item.description: It’s been a few weeks since I’ve been able to look at a #MakeoverMonday as I’ve been very busy with other things. But back at it this week, this time looking at beer prices at different baseball grounds…

item.title: MakeoverMonday 31-10-2018
item.description: This MakeoverMonday was looking at the prices of avocados in the USA. The original visualisation looked like this: What about the original could be improved? The background image is distracting and makes it harder to read the graph. Though it’s clear from the title, I’d rather have some indication of time on the x-axis…

item.title: MakeoverMonday 24-09-2018
item.description: MakeoverMonday was focussed on global gender equality, with a dataset from Equal Measures 2030 which consisted of survey results asking global advocates about their priorities and converns around existing data sources…

item.title: MakeoverMonday 17-09-2018
item.description: MakeoverMonday this week was on the topic of transport costs, and remaking a chart original produced by DW.com. The original visualisation was a simple line chart showing the prices of train and plane tickets as the date of the journey approaches…

item.title: Tidy Tueday - 18-09-2018
item.description: For this #TidyTuesday there we two different datasets to look at, one was a table from an article in the magazine of the “Soaring Society of America” and the other was a dataset containing detailed information on US airports…

item.title: MakeoverMonday 10-09-2018
item.description: This week’s #MakeoverMonday challenge was to take a dataset contributed by ProPublica of spending by politicians/government agencies at properties owned by Donald Trump…

item.title: Tidy Tuesday - 11-09-2018
item.description: This is a slightly late submission, didn’t have time during the week as I was at EARL for most of the week (hope to write a few words on this soon!)…

item.title: Exploring test cricket boundary rates in R
item.description: This past Friday, I was in the pub with a couple of colleagues watching the cricket. As you’d expect for a bunch of people who deal with numbers all day, there’s was a lot discussion of various statistics…

item.title: Tidy Tuesday 04-09-2018
item.description: Over the last few months, I’d been taking part in #MakeoverMonday to practice different types of visualisation. I’ve not written these up yet, but plenty of examples can be seen on my Twitter…

item.title: #SWDchallenge - September 2018
item.description: This was the second time that I’ve taken part in the #SWDchallenge. Full details of the challenge can be seen here. The summary is that the goal is to remake this pie chart into something better…
